definitions.definition: Prudence when faced with, or when expecting to face, danger; care taken in order to avoid risk or harm.
examples: utmost caution is required when travelling in this dangerous neighbourhood

definitions.definition: A careful attention to the probable effects of an act, in order that failure or harm may be avoided.
examples: The guideline expressed caution against excessive radiographic imaging.

definitions.definition: One who draws attention or causes astonishment by their behaviour.
examples: Oh, that boy, he's a caution ! He does make me laugh.

definitions.definition: A formal warning given as an alternative to prosecution in minor cases .

main_definition: Prudence when faced with, or when expecting to face, danger; care taken in order to avoid risk or harm.
secondary_definitions: A careful attention to the probable effects of an act, in order that failure or harm may be avoided.
( dated ) One who draws attention or causes astonishment by their behaviour.
( law ) A formal warning given as an alternative to prosecution in minor cases .
